revised_title: An Extraordinary Appearance in a Mist: Observations and Theories
tldr: In 1768, William Cockin observed a unique meteorological phenomenon in a mist, which appeared as two bright places with curved spaces of different colors. The phenomenon was described as being on an eminence overlooking low meadow ground. The author discusses the possible causes and theories behind this appearance, including the influence of the observer's shadow and the form, size, and properties of the mist's particles.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Optics
